owl:Ontology.terms:abstract: Consent is one of the legal basis for processing personal data under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), which is the current Eurpoean data protection law enforced from 25th May 2018. GDPR stipulates obligations on how consent should be obtained, used, modified, and recorded. Additionally, it provides data subjects with the right to modify or withdraw their consent at any time. Demonstrating compliance to these rights and obligations requires maintaining information about the consent lifecycle. Existing work has demonstrated the feasibility of using semantic web technologies to represent and query this information. GConsent is an OWL2 ontology for representing consent for GDPR compliance. The ontology is based on an analysis of modelling metadata requirements related to the consent lifecycle for GDPR compliance. It allows modelling and representation of information related to compliance in an extensible and comprehensive manner.
owl:Ontology.terms:creator: https://harshp.com/i/me#HJP
owl:Ontology.terms:description: GConsent provides concepts and relationships for defining consent and its associated information or metadata with a view towards GDPR compliance. It is the outcome of an analysis of consent and requirements associated with obtaining, using, and changes in consent as per the GDPR. The ontology also provides an approach to using its terms in various scenarios and use-cases (see more information in the documentation) which is intended to assist in its adoption.
owl:Ontology.terms:title: GConsent - a consent ontology based on the GDPR

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the location at which the consent was given.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: at location

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the instant at which the consent was created/given/changed.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: at time

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links the consent to personal data it is associated with it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: for personal data

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links the consent with its associated processing.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: for processing

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links a consent instace to the purpose(s) it is associated with.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: for purpose

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates an Association with another entity for a Purpose or Processing
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has association

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links a data subject to their consent.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has consent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links a consent instance to the context in which it was acquired/provided/given.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has context

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the Instant or Duration in which the consent expires.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has expiry

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates the role played by specified Person or Organisation or Third Party in the specified Association.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: hasRole

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes the state or status of consent.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has status

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the medium through which the consent was given. Examples are web forms, paper documents.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: in medium

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates the involvement by association of a Third Party.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: involves third party

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates an Association is for the associated Purpose or Processing.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is association for

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links a consent instance with the data subject it is associated with.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is consent for data subject

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: links a context to the consent instance it describes
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is context for consent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links personal data with the consent it is associated with.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is personal data for consent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Denotes that this consent instance is the previous consent for the specified consent instance.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is previous consent for

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links an action to the purpose it is associated with.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is action for purpose

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates the entity or activitiy that provided the consent.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is provided by

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the delegation that provided this consent.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is provided by delegation

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the Person that provided this consent.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is provided by person

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates the Person or Data Controller the consent was provided to.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is provided to

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates the Organisation the consent was provided to.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is provided to controller

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates the Person the consent was provided to.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is provided to person

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links purpose with the consent instance associated with it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is purpose for consent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links a status to the consent that uses it.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is status for consent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Specifies the consent instance which this instance is an update or revision of.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is updated consent for

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Links the entity or activity that gave consent to the entity or activity representing the consent (or its delegation).
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: gave consent

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Indicates sharing of personal data with a Third Party through the association.
Indicates that the specified Person or Data Controller was provided the associated consent.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: was provided consent

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Consent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Adaptation of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Adaptation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Alignment of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Alignment

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Alteration of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Alteration

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Collection of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Collection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Combination of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Combination

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Consultation of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Consultation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Data Controller is defined as "The natural or legal person, public authority, agency or other body which, alone or jointly with others, determines the purposes and means of the processing of personal data."
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Controller

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Destruction of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Destruction

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Disclosure by Transmission of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Disclosure by Transmission

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Dissemination of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Dissemination

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Erasure of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Erasure

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Organisation of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Organisation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Recording of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Recording

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Restriction of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Restriction

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Retrieval of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Retrieval

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Type of processing where sharing of data takes place with a Third Party.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Sharing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Storage of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Storage

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Structuring of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Structuring

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Data Subject is defined as an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’); an identifiable natural person is one who can be identified, directly or indirectly, in particular by reference to an identifier such as a name, an identification number, location data, an online identifier or to one or more factors specific to the physical, physiological, genetic, mental, economic, cultural or social identity of that natural person; - according to Article 4(1) of the GDPR pertaining to the definition of Personal Data.
In the case of this ontology, a Data Subject refers to the person(s) as per the definition of the GDPR. Since a Data Subject is a Person, it is defined as a subclass of foaf:Person.
The Data Subject is linked to the Consent instance via the isConsentForDataSubject and hasConsent properties.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Subject

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the type of processing where Use of data takes place.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Data Use

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Delegation of consent occurs when another entity, whether a data subject or their representative or an automated mechanism, provides the consent on behalf of the intended Data Subject. The delegated consent is provided through the mechanism of a _delegation_. This involves three entities - the Data Subject the delegation occurs for, the entity that acts as the delegate, and the mechanism used to verify the authority to delegate. They (first two) are provided respectively by the properties `isConsentDelegationFor`, and `hasConsentGivenByDelegate`.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Delegation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents a consent entity that is considered given whether implicitly, explicitly, or by delegation.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Given Consent

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Describes the medium through which consent was given/provided. Example: web form, recorded voice, signature on document.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Medium

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A Minor is a Data Subject who cannot provide their own consent (that is legally valid). Therefore, their consent must be obtained via a Guardian or Legal Representative or Parent. Minor is a subclass of Data Subject.
Consent given in lieu of a Minor (by their Representative) is associated with the `ConsentInstance` class/instance using the `wasGivenBy` property.
The ontology currently does not capture this relationship between the Minor and their Representative. This is due to required clarifications regarding how this role should be represented. For example, the `DataSubject` cannot be subclassed to create a `Representative` class, as this would make the `DataSubject` a permanent representative for the Minor. Instead, the role of 'acting as representative' is only for the instance of the given consent. Therefore, this could be represented with a `ConsentRepresentativeRole` class that links to the `MinorDataSubject` with `roleHadDataSubject` property, and the `DataSubject` that gave the consent via the `roleHadRepresentative` property. The relationship or reason or situation of this given consent can be captured by further annotating the `ConsentRepresentativeRole` instance. This approach can also be extended to other similar situations where one `DataSubject` gives consent in lieu of another.
Note: A Minor can provide their own consent in certain cases, or conversely, a minor's consent may need to be provided by a 'parental' representative in some cases.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Minor Data Subject

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: As per Article 4(1) of the GDPR, ‘personal data’ means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person (‘data subject’);
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Personal Data

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
Processing is defined by the GDPR (Article 4-2) as "any operation or set of operations which is performed on personal data or on sets of personal data, whether or not by automated means, such as collection, recording, organisation, structuring, storage, adaptation or alteration, retrieval, consultation, use, disclosure by transmission, dissemination or otherwise making available, alignment or combination, restriction, erasure or destruction;".
Processing can be considered as the action, within an activity for example, that uses data in a particular or specific way. Therefore, processing specifies what is happening to/with the data.
To define a type of processing (or its associated action), the Processing class should be subclassed for each type. Furthermore, each subclass should define a instance as a generic representative of that action. For example, "collect" as a type of processing (defined by the GDPR), is defined as the class DataCollection, which is a subclass of Processing, and has the individual CollectionOfPersonalData to represent a generic instance of the concept. This is to provide a ready-to-use ontology in terms of "collect" as an action, while also providing a way to specialise the action/processing. GConsent defines several such types of processing taken from the text of the GDPR.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Purpose refers to the aim or goal towards which the data is processed (or associated with any other form of action).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Purpose

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents the status of consent for the data subject. This allows persisting the determination of the validatity or suitability of consent (as an entity or instance) for use in processing and other activities. Examples: consent is given, consent is requested but not given, consent was withdrawn.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Status

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents consent states that are invalid for processing.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Status invalid for Processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents consent states that are valid for processing
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Status valid for Processing

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Represents an Agent that is a Person or an Organisation other than the current entity (w.r.t. data protection laws).
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Third Party

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Indicates consent is given via delegation.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Given by Delegation

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Indicates consent is given via an implicit action or assumption.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Implicitly Given

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Indicates the consent has been invalidated.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Invalidated

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Indicates that consent has not been given.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Not Given

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Indicates that consent has been refused (to be given).
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Refused

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Indicates consent has been requested but has not been given (yet).
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Requested

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Indicates the consent status is unknown.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Unknown

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Represents Disclosure by Transmission Of personal data.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: Disclosure by Transmission Of Personal Data
